result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Chavarria-Olivas

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel Chavarria-Olivas appeared by video.  Attorney Charles David Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Michael Armbrecht appeared by phone for Daniel Chavarria-Olivas. Interpreter Enrique Soria appears via zoom video and was sworn in by Judge. Attorney states that they have a resolution. Attorney states that Defendant would like an in person hearing and requests an October date. Court schedules plea/sentencing date. Enrique Soria to interpret for Defendant.
Notice of Hearing- Return to Sender Not Deliverable as Addressed Unable to Forward
